meanings.definition: An institution of higher education offering courses at the undergraduate level.
meanings.sent1: My sister attends a local college to study business.
meanings.sent2: I graduated from college last year with a degree in psychology.
meanings.sent3: The college of chefs gathered to discuss new recipes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a college of knowledge, each subject a different building.
meanings.sent5: The college campus buzzed with excitement during orientation week.

meanings.definition: A constituent unit of a university, furnishing courses of instruction in the liberal arts and sciences, usually leading to a bachelor's degree.
meanings.sent1: The history department is part of the college of arts and sciences.
meanings.sent2: She chose to major in English literature at college.
meanings.sent3: The college of artists painted a mural on the city wall.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a college of emotions, each feeling a different student.
meanings.sent5: The college building stood tall against the backdrop of the city skyline.

meanings.definition: A group of persons having a common purpose or common duties.
meanings.sent1: Our team at work operates like a college, always helping each other.
meanings.sent2: The college of volunteers worked together to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The college of friends organized a surprise party for her birthday.
meanings.sent4: Their family was a college of support, always there for one another.
meanings.sent5: The college of musicians played in perfect harmony during the concert.
